summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) personnel, discussing the sharing of a declaration from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding mental health services. The emails suggest the information is relevant to an extradition matter, possibly involving the UK, and mention Special Administrative Measures (SAMs).

persons.name: Rebold
persons.context: A prosecutor in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) who is sharing a BOP declaration about mental health services and offering to share additional materials regarding Special Administrative Measures (SAMs).

persons.name: Max
persons.context: A prosecutor in the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) who is receiving the BOP declaration and expressing gratitude for the helpful information.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, collaborating on legal matters involving BOP declarations and extradition.

events.title: Email Exchange on BOP Mental Health Declaration
events.description: Prosecutors in the USANYS office exchange emails regarding a declaration from the Bureau of Prisons about mental health services, noting its relevance to an ongoing extradition matter.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively sharing a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) declaration concerning mental health services in April 2020.
The correspondence indicates the BOP declaration was relevant to an extradition matter, with specific mention of a potential UK extradition.
The emails reference Special Administrative Measures (SAMs), suggesting the underlying case may involve high-security or sensitive detainee issues.
